entities.description: The act of unlawfully seizing and carrying away a person by force or fraud.
The unlawful sexual activity and usually sexual intercourse carried out forcibly or under threat of injury against the will of a person.
Sexual acts involving anal or oral copulation.
Non-consensual sexual penetration with an object.
Indecent liberties or child molesting, involving touching of a sexual nature.
The taking or attempting to take anything of value by force, threat of force, or by putting the victim in fear.
An unlawful attack by one person upon another for the purpose of inflicting severe or aggravated bodily injury.
An unlawful physical attack by one person upon another where neither the offender displays a weapon nor the victim suffers obvious severe or aggravated bodily injury.

To unlawfully place another person in reasonable fear of bodily harm through the use of threatening words and/or other conduct but without displaying a weapon or subjecting the victim to actual physical attack.
Any willful or malicious burning or attempt to burn, with or without intent to defraud, a dwelling house, public building, motor vehicle or aircraft, personal property of another, etc.
Unlawfully obtaining money, property, or any other thing of value through the use of coercion or threats.
The unlawful entry of a structure to commit a felony or theft.
The theft of articles from another person's physical possession by stealth where the victim usually does not become immediately aware of the theft.
The grabbing or snatching of a purse, handbag, etc., from the physical possession of another person.
The theft, by someone other than an employee of the victim, of goods or merchandise exposed for sale.
A theft from a machine or device that is operated or activated by the use of coins.
The theft of articles from a motor vehicle, whether locked or unlocked.
The theft of any part or accessory attached to the interior or exterior of a motor vehicle in a manner which would make the part an accessory of the vehicle.
All thefts which do not fit any of the definitions of the specific subcategories of larceny/theft are included as other larceny.
The theft or attempted theft of a motor vehicle.

The altering, copying, or imitation of something, without authority or right, with the intent to deceive or defraud by passing the copy or thing altered or imitated as that which is original or genuine.
The intentional misrepresentation of existing facts or conditions, or the use of some other deceptive scheme or device to obtain money, goods, or other things of value.
The fraudulent use of a credit card, debit card, or another access device to unlawfully obtain money, goods, or services.
Falsely representing one’s identity or position for purposes of deceiving others.
The use of deceitful statements, practices, or devices to wrongly obtain undeserved payment from public assistance programs like welfare.
The intentional act of fraud using electronic communications, such as telegraph, telephone, radio, or television.
The fraudulent acquisition and use of a person's private identifying information, usually for financial gain.
Unauthorized access to, or use of, systems, networks, systems, software, or data.
The unlawful misappropriation or misapplication by an offender to his/her own use or purpose of money, property, or some other thing of value entrusted to his/her care, custody, or control.
Receiving, buying, selling, possessing, concealing, or transporting property with the knowledge that it has been unlawfully taken, as by theft, burglary, or fraud.
Willfully or maliciously destroying, damaging, defacing, or otherwise injuring real or personal property without the consent of the owner or the person having custody or control of it.
The unlawful possession, distribution, manufacture, cultivation, sale, purchase, use, transportation, or importation of narcotic drugs.
The unlawful manufacture, sale, purchase, possession, or use of equipment or devices used for preparing, distributing, or using drugs/narcotics.
Non-forcible sexual intercourse between persons who are related to each other within the degrees wherein marriage is prohibited by law.
Non-forcible sexual intercourse with a person who is under the statutory age of consent.
The violation of laws or ordinances prohibiting the manufacture, publishing, sale, purchase, or possession of sexually explicit material.
Unlawful participation in games of chance for money or things of value or unlawfully wagering on the outcome of a contest of chance or a future contingent event.
The unlawful operation, promotion, or assistance of gambling businesses and operations.

Involves an incident of theft from a motor vehicle.
Involves an incident of theft of motor vehicle parts or accessories.
Involves an incident of other larceny.
Involves an incident of motor vehicle theft.
Involves an incident of counterfeiting or forgery.
Involves an incident of false pretenses, swindle, or confidence game.
Involves an incident of credit card fraud involving an ATM.
Involves an incident of impersonation.

Involves an incident of wire fraud.
Involves an incident of identity theft.
Involves an incident of hacking or computer invasion.

Involves an incident of drug or narcotic violations.

Involves an incident of pornography or obscene material.
